message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with private information retrieval (PIR) protocols for distributed storage systems (DSSs), which involve coding theory, information theory, and cryptography. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses linear codes, which are a fundamental concept in coding theory, and their properties in achieving PIR capacity. Hence, cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also presents protocols for distributed storage systems, which involve distributed systems and their security, making cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the optimization of PIR rate, which involves algorithms and optimization techniques, making cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) a possible sub-category as well.
